ISSUE.TITLE: [CI] Meta task not updating EC2 images
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: **Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST? (leave only one on its own line)** /kind bug **Description** For `main` and all release branches v4.0 and more recent utilize AWS EC2 for podman machine testing. However, the meta task has not been updated with EC2 support. Within 30-days of inactivity, EC2 images may be culled. This would be disastrous for release-branches. **Steps to reproduce the issue:** 1. Ignore it **Describe the results you received:** Meta task does not update metadata on EC2 AMIs used for testing **Describe the results you expected:** Meta task updates all images used by CI on the branch. **Additional information you deem important (e.g. issue happens only occasionally):** **Output of `podman version`:** N/A **Output of `podman info`:** N/A **Package info (e.g. output of `rpm -q podman` or `apt list podman`):** N/A **Have you tested with the latest version of Podman and have you checked the Podman Troubleshooting Guide? (https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/main/troubleshooting.md)** Yes **Additional environment details (AWS, VirtualBox, physical, etc.):** The current (as of opening this issue) version of the imgts container supports both AMI and image name-tag references. However, this is only activated if the `EC2IMGNAMES` (newline separated) list of images is set, along with an `AWSINI` encrypted value.
